intro: Pseudarabidella, commonly known as the false arabidella, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and small, compound leaves that resemble those of other members of the carrot family. The flowers are typically small and clustered in umbels, a common feature among Apiaceae plants. Pseudarabidella species are native to various regions in the Americas, particularly in arid and semi-arid environments. These plants are generally herbaceous and may have some medicinal or ecological significance in their native habitats.
